sections.title: Changes to this policy
sections.content:
We may amend this Policy at any time by posting a revised version on our Website. The revised version will apply to Visitors with effect from the time we post it. However, we will provide Customers with at least 60 days' prior notice of any such revision by posting notice of the change on the Website and the revision will then apply to Customers with effect from the date indicated in such notice, provided that if you are a Customer and you are not happy with the revisions made, you should stop using the Website in any way and may request us to deactivate your Account with us (or, if you are a Seller, to terminate the service subscribed for by you in that regard).

Subject to Section 12(h) of this Agreement, the Company reserves the right to modify the terms and conditions of this Agreement or its policies relating to the Website, Software, or Services at any time, effective upon posting of an updated version of this Agreement on the Website or Software. You should regularly review this Agreement, as your continued use of the Services after any such changes constitutes your agreement to such changes.

The Company uses a network of independent third-party contractors (Izinto Hoppers) who provide delivery services to our users and laundry, sneaker cleaning, and car wash service providers. It is up to each Izinto hopper to provide such delivery services. The Laundry, Sneaker Cleaning, and Car Wash Service Providers available through our Services ("Service Providers") also operate independently of the Company. The Company will not assess the suitability, legality, or ability of any Izinto Hopper or Laundry Service Provider. The Company is not responsible for the Laundry, Sneaker Cleaning, and Car Wash Service Providers' services or safety and does not verify their compliance with applicable laws or regulations. The Company has no responsibility or liability for acts by any third-party Laundry Service Provider or Izinto Hopper, other than as stated herein.

How you can contact us about privacy questions
If you have questions or concerns regarding this Policy, you can contact us at info@izinto.africa or Call/WhatsApp +27 81 725 8447. Contact hours are weekdays from 8:00 to 22:00 and Saturdays and Sundays from 8:00 to 22:00.

sections.title: Information We Collect
sections.content:
We collect information you provide directly to us when you register for an account, use our services, or communicate with us. This includes:

- Personal identification information (name, email, phone number)
- Delivery addresses and location data
- Payment information and transaction history
- Service preferences and usage patterns
- Communications, feedback, and support requests
- Device information and IP addresses

sections.title: How We Use Your Information
sections.content:
We use the information we collect to:

- Provide, maintain, and improve our services
- Process transactions and send order confirmations
- Personalize your experience and service recommendations
- Communicate with you about services, offers, and updates
- Monitor and analyze trends, usage, and activities
- Detect, prevent, and address technical issues and fraud
- Comply with legal obligations and enforce our terms

sections.title: Information Sharing and Disclosure
sections.content:
We do not sell your personal information to third parties. We may share your information in the following circumstances:

- With service providers who perform services on our behalf (payment processors, delivery partners)
- To comply with legal obligations or respond to lawful requests
- To protect and defend our rights, property, and safety
- In connection with a business transfer, merger, or acquisition
- With your consent or at your direction

All third-party service providers are bound by confidentiality agreements.

sections.title: Data Security
sections.content:
We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. These measures include:

- Encryption of sensitive data in transit and at rest
- Regular security assessments and vulnerability testing
- Access controls and authentication mechanisms
- Secure data storage and backup procedures
- Employee training on data protection practices

While we strive to protect your information, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.

sections.title: Your Rights and Choices
sections.content:
You have the following rights regarding your personal information:

- Access and receive a copy of your personal information
- Correct or update inaccurate information
- Delete your information (subject to legal requirements)
- Object to processing of your information
- Data portability in a machine-readable format
- Withdraw consent where processing is based on consent
- Opt-out of marketing communications

To exercise these rights, contact us at info@izinto.africa.

sections.title: Data Retention
sections.content:
We retain your personal information only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, including to provide our services, comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements. Typical retention periods include:

- Account information: While account is active plus 3 years
- Transaction data: 7 years for tax and legal compliance
- Service records: 3 years after service completion
- Marketing data: Until consent is withdrawn

We regularly review our retention practices to ensure compliance.

sections.title: International Data Transfers
sections.content:
Izinto is based in South Africa and processes data primarily within South Africa. However, we may transfer and process your information in other countries where our service providers operate. When we transfer information across borders, we implement appropriate safeguards to ensure your data receives adequate protection, including:

- Standard contractual clauses approved by regulatory authorities
- Data processing agreements with third-party providers
- Security assessments of international partners
- Compliance with applicable data protection laws
